message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC. 

This paper deals with the problem of identifying the important words in a query that depict the actual information need of the user, which is a core problem in Information Retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a sequence-to-sequence based neural architecture, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, making cs.CL a likely sub-category as well. The model leverages past queries and explored results, which involves learning from user behavior, making cs.HC a possible sub-category. The paper also evaluates the model on the task of next query suggestion, which involves machine learning (ML) techniques, making cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories.
